title: Playing aggresive early bad as twitch?
body: i find him to be, Just to squishy (especially early) yes you can out trade but only if you get 2-3 or more autos and e not just autos

replies.body: I don't think anyone can win early against a good Graves player. {{champion:104}}

I kind of see what you may mean; Graves dashes, she nets out, outrages him all game, two opposing ults. But I can also see a thresh or Leona support getting the drop on cait and peeling for their ADC.

> [{quoted}](name=kJs,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=nAIIYEif,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-05-18T00:57:08.053+0000)
>
> I don't think anyone can win early against a good Graves player. {{champion:104}}

Yeah, hes the best alrounder so im scurred.. but mid game hes an even match then super late hes meh (to twitch)
Depends on the matchup and what support you have, it's better to play it safe early as twitch until you get a blade.

> [{quoted}](name=BUY MY MIXTAPE,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=nAIIYEif,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-05-18T00:52:59.835+0000)
>
> Depends on the matchup and what support you have, it's better to play it safe early as twitch until you get a blade.

Thats what im thinking, but if i have a morg i go ham early and turkey late, (LOL WHAT), so twitch's power spike is bork? or would it be greaves,bork,yomous
I haven't played a lot of twitch this season but I feel like blade is when you can go ham, well that's how I play him, when I get blade I look to assassinate mid or something.
